page.title: 17LEGEND IN KIRKBY LONSDALE
page.content: One of the most prominent features of Kirkby Lonsdale,and the most visited,is{Devil's Bridge.}This medieval bridge has 3 arches,the central one of which spans the river Lune with a large arch.It originally carried all the traffic but was closed in{1928}and now serves pedestrians only.In summer chidren and others sometimes jump from the bridge into the deep water below.The origin of the bridge is unknown,but legend has it that a man and his dog wanted to cross the flooded river.An old woman or {witch}appeared and offered to build him a bridge,provided she could have the soul of the first living creature which crossed it.When the bridge was completed the man threw some food across the bridge and the dog ran after it and so crossed first.In her anger the witch disapeared.
